channel.title: Is my laptop good for gaming?
channel.description:
[ul]Hey guys, I just bought a new laptop and wondering if this would be good for gaming:
[list] [li]Processor: AMD E-300 APU with Radeon(tm) HD Graphics 1.30 GHz [/li][li]Ram: 4.00 GB (3.60 GB usable) [/li][li]System Type: 64-bit Operating System, x64-based-processor [/li][li]Total system memory: 500GB[/li][/list][/ul]

item.title: Is my laptop good for gaming?
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:12, topic:531328”][quote author=xxx123xxx link=topic=650091.msg4365832#msg4365832 date=1379663092]

intel hd graphics is horrible for gaming. You will be able to play like bejeweled or something but don’t expect a miracle with games.

You could actually play some decent games with intel integrated graphics. TF2, LoL, Smite, NeverWinter, etc. etc. Some even on decent settings.
[/quote]I had an integrated card as well so I was basing it from that. I wasn’t 100% which iintegrated gpu it was. “HD graphics” doesn’t mean a lot.[/quote]

Considering it’s an AMD product I doubt he would have Intels hd graphics.

Read full topic
item.source: Is my laptop good for gaming?

@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“xxx123xxx, post:11, topic:531328”][quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=650091.msg4365734#msg4365734 date=1379639451]
intel hd graphics is horrible for gaming. You will be able to play like bejeweled or something but don’t expect a miracle with games.
[/quote]

You could actually play some decent games with intel integrated graphics. TF2, LoL, Smite, NeverWinter, etc. etc. Some even on decent settings.[/quote]I had an integrated card as well so I was basing it from that. I wasn’t 100% which iintegrated gpu it was. “HD graphics” doesn’t mean a lot.

item.title: Is my laptop good for gaming?
item.dc:creator: @xxx123xxx xxx123xxx
item.description:
@xxx123xxx wrote:

Loveandpower:

intel hd graphics is horrible for gaming. You will be able to play like bejeweled or something but don’t expect a miracle with games.

You could actually play some decent games with intel integrated graphics. TF2, LoL, Smite, NeverWinter, etc. etc. Some even on decent settings.

item.title: Is my laptop good for gaming?
item.dc:creator: @Muroth Muroth
item.description:
@Muroth wrote:

FromAutumnToAshes:

Well, im running GTA SA and Fallout 3 just fine, no lag at all.

you’ll be able to run most games, but expect some lag in newer games if you’re trying to play on max FPS

Read full topic

item.title: Is my laptop good for gaming?
item.dc:creator: @chillwitm888 chillwitm888
item.description:
@chillwitm888 wrote:

Loveandpower:

intel hd graphics is horrible for gaming. You will be able to play like bejeweled or something but don’t expect a miracle with games.

he said it was an apu, any how any integrated graphics won’t be fantastic for gaming. You will probably be able to run runescape, lol, Minecraft but don’t expect much more than that

item.title: Is my laptop good for gaming?
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Muroth, post:5, topic:531328”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=650091.msg4365640#msg4365640 date=1379623757]
could be either one

go to control panel, device manager, and then it will be under display adapters
[/quote]

GPU: AMD Radeon HD 6300 series Graphics[/quote]if the laptop didn’t come with another graphics card then yes, he already said that, but the point is im asking if it has ANOTHER one (most gaming laptops would)

if not, no, your laptop is not good for gaming

Read full topic
item.source: Is my laptop good for gaming?
